intro: Paracostus englerianus, commonly known as the Engler's paracostus, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats and has narrow, linear leaves. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in a dense cluster, and it produces achenes as its seeds. Paracostus englerianus is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
